so_18515889: tail -n1

$ echo "{print $(printf '$%d%.0s\n' \
                      $(i=0; for x in $(tail -n1 test.dat); do
                               echo $((++i)) $x
                             done |
                      sort -k2g) | paste -sd,)}" test.dat
{print $3,$1,$2} test.dat

tail -n+$L|head -n1

so_40814891: cuenta=1
awk -F: -v var="$cuenta" '$1 == var {print $0}' $documento | cut -d":" -f1,2,4

Explanations about Options.-d: use DELIM instead of TAB for field delimiter
Explanations about Options.-f:
select only these fields; also print any line that contains no delimiter
 character, unless the -s option is specified
